diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Cholelithiasis with acute on chronic cholecystitis with hydrops of the gallbladder.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by the presence of a distended gallbladder containing three large gallstones, gallbladder wall edema, and pericholecystic fluid as observed in the MRCP findings. The patient's history of sudden abdominal pain radiating to the right upper quadrant, along with the physical examination findings of tenderness in that region and the palpable gallbladder, further supported the diagnosis.
